content:
@Jane Lusby , @Jakub Duchniewicz , @Ashley Mannix , please dump your thoughts on the blog post draft I wrote up here when you're able :smile:
https://hackmd.io/GMLcORX_R7W4de0ZryDIxg?view
@Sean Chen links point back to the doc :)
Thanks! Yea, I'll have to make a pass over the links and make sure they're all sound before posting it.
Looking good to me, the generics part is well documented :) From what I understand it is like a template function instantiation in C++

Yes, with the qualification that generics are type-bound when using them in a way that C++ does not require, which makes Rust's generics less flexible... in practical cases, since people are usually trying to just use C++'s templates to achieve what they could in Rust's generics, this just means that Rust has better error messages and the papercuts are on the writing end rather than the debugging end. But there's a few... less usual differences.

now that this has been released might we be reaching out for
feedbacks from the community? ( i.e. the internals form, etc )
How would we go about distributing a form like that?
I was thinking of a discussion post rather than a survey form

i.e. the internals form

I think oliver meant "the internals forum" :)

... or a survey sure, just looking at the action item of
getting broad feedback on the blog post and project
